TopicTitle: Stand Alone Map View - Multi monitor KSP [1.4.x][Plugin]

Articles.Content:
ah, nice, so visual enhancements do run on the server-instance.

I just wonder, if it is possible to run 2 maps at the same time. (because sometimes an angle is just bad, or at planning an encounter, I need to see the point with my ship, and the target planet at the same time... 2 maps would be just very handy).

regarding maneuvernodes: maybe team up with the guy from precise maneuvernodes, as he has a direct readout of the maneuvernode-values, and syncing that could be easier.

It's currently not possible to run 2 map windows at once, as the server only talks to one at a time. This might be changed eventually, but I'll be working on all the other bugs and features as a first priority.

New release fresh off the press.

Download tar.gz or zip

Changelog:

* IP/hostname and port settings so you can use a separte computer

* Main menu now available in map view, so you can change settings

* Map view goes back to tracking station when main game leaves flight

* Fixed physics time warp bug

* Vessels no longer get stuck in landed state

* Toolbar support that doesn't work (bug in toolbar?)

I've gotten it to work on a single 1400 x 900 19 inch monitor, The only problem is that since the minimal supported resolution is 1024/728, at lower res some menu bouttons in places like the ship editors are unclickable. However, the map screen and play screen are displayed fine.

Download tar.gz or zip

The big news for this release is that maneuver nodes work! Play with them on either window/monitor and they will sync across to the other one.

Changelog:

* Maneuver node syncing (bidrectional) (#6)

* False asteroids no longer get spawned (#3)

* Settings windows start minimized so they are less obtrusive
"Neat!" - Bender Bending Rodriguez

You got it, a 64bit Windows 7 build. How did I never know about the windows + shift + left/right arrow hotkey? So simple... and it works with any window. WHY SO SECRET!?!

The day I learned about this shortcut was one of the most profound in my life. As a graphic designer with a dual monitor setup....essential to my workflow now.
I woudl love to have scansat map on another screen.

Download tar.gz or zip.

Changelog:

* Current target syncing

* Fixed a bug where the first save sync never happens

* Less "jumpyness" and reloading when client is sitting in the tracking station

* Fixed exceptions in the debug log

I'll be away for a bit so just in case there's any problems you can get previous versions here.

As for networking are you on a LAN? I haven't really tested network stuff yet, I'll take a poke when I get back in a couple of days. LAN should work but I wouldn't be surprised in internet doesn't yet.

If you are on LAN, make sure exact same mods are installed on both. Put client stuff on one, server on other. Delete any existing settings files "saves/samv *.cfg". Leave the ports alone and just change the IP address settings on the main menu.

Before you buy anything, test it out first. The minimum requirements listed are just best guesses, because I don't have a lot of hardware lying around to test it on. It's possible it might work with less, and it also depends on how many other mods you are running. To test it, you can run the mod without two monitors if you just run ksp in window mode rather than fullscreen.

but will my graphic card handle two instancec of ksp at once? its geforce gt 640m.

Not sure, I'm not really familiar with laptop graphics card performance. It also depends how many graphics mods (clouds etc) you are running as well. Again the best way to find out is to test it before buying any new hardware. Can you find a spare monitor (or a TV with hdmi/dvi) to test it out on?
